ArticleInfo.ArticleTitle: Morphology and photoelectrochemical characterization of MEH-PPV/PCBM composite film doped with TiO2 nanoparticles

ArticleCopyright.CopyrightHolderName: The Chinese Society for Metals and Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg

Affiliation.OrgDivision: Laboratoire d’électrochimie et matériaux (LEM), Faculté de Technologie
Affiliation.OrgName: Département de génie des Université Ferhat
ORGATECH Team Route de Saclay Paris

Abstract.Heading: Abstract
Abstract.Para: Poly[2-methoxy-5-(20-ethylhexyloxy)-p-phenylenevinylene] (MEH-PPV), [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PCBM) and titanium dioxide (TiO2) nanoparticles (n-type) were dissolved, mixed and deposited by physical methods (spin-coating) on indium tin-oxide (ITO) substrate. The incorporation of the titanium dioxide nanoparticles changed the morphology and increased the roughness of polymers film (MEH-PPV/PCBM), and the photocurrent density of the composite (MEH-PPV/PCBM +n-TiO2) was higher than that of single MEHPPV/ PCBM film. The study showed that the presence of n-TiO2 particles in the polymeric film improves the photoelectrochemical properties of MEH-PPV/PCBM composite.
